page.title: 09BEATING THE BOUND
page.content: Beating the bounds happens every seven years.They go round the boundaries of Benington.On every boundary they pick someone up and hit them with the shovel that they dig the cross with. The cross is put there to remind them where the boundary is.They dig out the shape of a cross and then put a wooden cross in.It starts at the church where they have a service for half an hour.It also finishes with a cup of tea and biscuits or sandwiches. Anyone who knows about it can do it. The people who did it this year, 1985, were Andrew Cummins,Robert Bell, Simon Clayton and Nicholas Ingamells. Most of the places they went were near dykes.
